thesis.description: This thesis describes the design and construction of a variable frequency three-phase inverter using transistors as the power switching elements, particularly suited for direct coupling to on active load such as an induction motor. The problems of transistor protection and regeneration of power to the inverter power supply are considered. It is shown that these design problems may be solved by the inclusion of a fast-acting electronic over-voltage crowbar and current-limiting in the power supply. The design and construction of a power supply with these features is presented. The complete open-loop supply-inverter combination is tested to specification on a fractional horsepower induction motor and practical results are presented and evaluated.
